title: Marine Artillery Units Land In Syria As Fight For Raqqa Looms
text:
Marine Artillery Units Land In Syria As Fight For Raqqa Looms Demolish and destroy ... Advertisement - story continues below 
As a candidate, President Donald Trump promised aggressive tactics to demolish ISIS. 
“I will quickly and decisively bomb the hell out of ISIS, will rebuild our military and make it so strong no-one — and I mean, no one — will mess with us,” Trump said on the campaign trail. 
This week, U.S. Marines landed in Syria to make good on that promise. Advertisement - story continues below 
— American Infidelđşđ¸ (@USA_Infidel247) March 9, 2017 
About 400 Marines of the 11th Marine Expeditionary Force, which had been based off shore in the Mediterranean Sea, landed this week as Syrian forces supported by the U.S. have said they are nearing the city of Raqqa, which has been a center of operations for ISIS in Syria. 
Marines will not be on the front lines, but will be providing artillery support using M777 Howitzers, which have the capability to hit targets 20 miles away. Advertisement - story continues below 
The artillery will help “expedite the defeat of ISIS in Raqqa,” said Air Force Colonel John Dorrian, a spokesman for the coalition of forces opposing ISIS. 
“We have had what I would describe as a pretty relentless air campaign to destroy enemy capabilities and to kill enemy fighters in that area already. That is something that we are going to continue and intensify with this new capability,” he added.

Joseph Votel, commander of U.S. Central Command, told the Senate Armed Services Committee on Thursday. 
Votel made it clear Americans will not be leading the charge. Advertisement - story continues below
